prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.6136, 0.0] Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch 1. Create a new face (face_1) on the X-Y plane. 2. Draw a circle (circle_1) on this face with the following properties: - Center: [0.0511, 0.0511] - Radius: 0.0511 Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1023. Step 4: Transform the Sketch into 3D Sketch Perform a 3D rotation on the scaled 2D sketch using the Euler angles from the coordinate system and translate it using the translation vector. Step 5: Extrude the 2D Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.5455 units to create the 3D model. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom (Simplified Cone) Step 1: Create Coordinate System Use the same coordinate system as Part 1, but translate it along the Z-axis by 0.017 units and the X-axis by 0.017 units: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.017, 0.0682, 0.017] Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch Repeat the same steps as Part 1, Step 2, to create a circle (circle_1) with the following properties: - Center: [0.0341, 0.0341] - Radius: 0.0341 Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by the same factor as Part 1, 0.1023. Step 4: Transform the Sketch into 3D Sketch Repeat the same steps as Part 1, Step 4. Step 5: Extrude the 2D Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0682 units to create the 3D model. Part 3: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Bottom Step 1: Create Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0852, 0.6136, 0.017] Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch Repeat the same steps as Part 1, Step 2, to create a circle (circle_1) with the following properties: - Center: [0.0341, 0.0341] - Radius: 0.0341 Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by the same factor as Part 1, 0.1023. Step 4: Transform the Sketch into 3D Sketch Repeat the same steps as Part 1, Step 4. Step 5: Extrude the 2D Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1364 units to create the 3D model. Final Shape: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Ends, Smooth Surface, and Solid Material Combine Part 1, Part 2, and Part 3 using the appropriate boolean operations as described in the "operation" key of their extrusion objects. The final shape should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.1023 - Width: 0.5455 - Height: 0.7579</description>

<description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Sketch 1. Draw the first face of the prism: - Create a new loop (loop_1) on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Add four lines to the loop: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] - line_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw the second face of the prism: - Create a new loop (loop_1) on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Add four lines to the loop: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] - line_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrusion 1. Extrude the sketch along the normal with the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.75 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.375 - Operation: Create a new solid body for this part Description shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom length: 0.375 width: 0.75 height: 0.375 Final Shape The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.375 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.375</description>

<description><part\\_1> Construct a rectangular prism with a pointed end, resembling a stylized arrow or a simplified representation of a roofing shingle. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0014, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. Step 3: Draw the first face of the rectangular prism. - Draw an arc with a start point at [0.0, 0.0524], a mid point at [0.0071, 0.0163], and an end point at [0.0402, 0.0]. - Draw a line from [0.0402, 0.0] to [0.2785, 0.0]. - Draw an arc with a start point at [0.2785, 0.0], a mid point at [0.3038, 0.0086], and an end point at [0.3186, 0.0308]. - Draw a line from [0.3186, 0.0308] to [0.4115, 0.3757]. - Draw a line from [0.4115, 0.3757] to [0.6037, 0.3757]. - Draw an arc with a start point at [0.6037, 0.3757], a mid point at [0.6331, 0.3879], and an end point at [0.6453, 0.4173]. - Draw a line from [0.6453, 0.4173] to [0.6453, 0.4589]. - Draw a line from [0.6453, 0.4589] to [0.3126, 0.4589]. - Draw a line from [0.3126, 0.4589] to [0.3126, 0.75]. - Draw a line from [0.3126, 0.75] to [0.2197, 0.75]. - Draw an arc with a start point at [0.2197, 0.75], a mid point at [0.1944, 0.7414], and an end point at [0.1796, 0.7192]. - Draw a line from [0.1796, 0.7192] to [0.0, 0.0524]. Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis (normal direction) by 0.0333. Step 6: Perform a "New Body Feature Operation" to create a new solid body. <part\\_1> Description shape: A 3D model of a rectangular prism with a pointed end, resembling a stylized arrow or a simplified representation of a roofing shingle. length: 0.0333 width: 0.75 height: 0.75 The instructions are provided in the context of the final shape and without any additional assumptions. The height, width, and length of each of the intermediate parts and the final shape are given. Each of the curves, loops, and faces is described with their respective start and end points, and in cases of arcs, mid points. The sequence is continuous, making it easier for a junior CAD designer to generate an accurate CAD model. The boolean operation of the current body with the previous body is described in natural language instead of specific terms, and clear headings and section breaks are used to organize each part's instructions.</description>

<description>Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Start by creating a new coordinate system: 1. Set the Euler angles to (0, 0, -90) degrees. 2. Set the translation vector to (0, 0.0643, 0.0026). Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system using the information from the sketch component: 1. On face 1 of the sketch, draw loop 1. 2. Loop 1 consists of 4 curves: line 1, arc 1, line 2, and arc 2. 3. Curve 1: Draw a line from (0.0357, 0.1046) to (0.5802, 0). 4. Curve 2: Draw an arc from (0.5802, 0) to (0.5802, 0.2806) with a midpoint at (0.75, 0.1403). 5. Curve 3: Draw a line from (0.5802, 0.2806) to (0.0357, 0.176). 6. Curve 4: Draw an arc from (0.0357, 0.176) to (0.0357, 0.1046) with a midpoint at (0, 0.1403). The resulting sketch describes a rectangular shape with a curved top section. Close the sketch. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the coordinate system’s Euler angles and translation vector, and scale the 2D sketch by the factor 0.75 as defined by the sketch_scale parameter. Extrude the 3D Sketch along the Z-axis using the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal parameter of 0.0357 to reach the final dimensions of this part: 0.75 units in length, 0.0357 units in width, and 0.75 units in height. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Start by creating a new coordinate system: 1. Set the Euler angles to (0, 0, -90) degrees. 2. Set the translation vector to (0.0179, 0.0286, 0.125). Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system: 1. On face 1 of the sketch, draw loop 1. 2. Loop 1 consists of only 1 curve: circle 1. 3. Curve 1: Draw a circle with a center at (0.0179, 0.0179) and a radius of 0.0179. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the coordinate system’s Euler angles and translation vector. Scale the 2D sketch by the factor 0.0357 (sketch\\_scale), and extrude the 3D Sketch along the Z-axis using the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal parameter of 0.0286. The resulting part has final dimensions of 0.0357 units in length, 0.0286 units in width, and 0.0357 units in height. The join operation is specified in the operation property, describing integration with the preceding CAD model(s). Upon completion, the combination of these parametric parts will form the final shape resembling a stylized, white, three-dimensional light bulb.</description>
